title: Serif display face from 1980s bridge strategy book
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005747im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-08-31%20at%205_4804.57.23%20PM.png)

This is the titling face from William Root’s 1986 book on bridge strategy, “Commonsense Bidding”. I've found a few similar faces, but nothing that matches the interesting construction of the lowercase 'a' – any ideas what this might be?

Font: 

 Tom's Roman 

Solved By: 

 [Jan](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416005747/http:/typophile.com/user/17243 "View user profile.")
